verses.roman:
taṁ kaścit svīkariṣyantaṁ
puruṣaḥ kṛṣṇa-darśanaḥ
uvācottarato 'bhyetya
mamedaṁ vāstukaṁ vasu

synonyms: tam—unto Nābhāga; kaścit—someone; svīkariṣyantam—while accepting the riches given by the great sages; puruṣaḥ—a person; kṛṣṇa-darśanaḥ—black-looking; uvāca—said; uttarataḥ—from the north; abhyetya—coming; mama—my; idam—these; vāstukam—remnants of the sacrifice; vasu—all the riches.
translation: Thereafter, while Nābhāga was accepting the riches, a black-looking person from the north came to him and said, "All the wealth from this sacrificial arena belongs to me."
